item.title: Osrs cache dump tut?
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

that is a manual rewrite of an npc def, Look in your npc definition file, to find out how they are read from the cache. You can use that file to make it to a full dump of the cache.

Read full topic

item.title: Osrs cache dump tut?
item.dc:creator: @loliepopcool loliepopcool
item.description:
@loliepopcool wrote:

I have problems trying to find the right anim configs for osrs npcs, like i cannot find stuff like this:

		case 1828:
			//fileID: 1802
			anims[1828] = new Animation();
			anims[1828].anInt352 = 16;
			anims[1828].anInt356 = -1;
			anims[1828].anInt359 = 5;
			anims[1828].anInt360 = -1;
			anims[1828].anInt361 = -1;
			anims[1828].anInt362 = 99;
			anims[1828].anInt363 = 0;
			anims[1828].anInt364 = 0;
			anims[1828].anInt365 = 2;
			anims[1828].aBoolean358 = false;
			anims[1828].anIntArray353 = new int[] {118095921, 118095916, 118096259, 118096320, 118096299, 118096329, 118096036, 118095925, 118096180, 118096105, 118096311, 118095880, 118096084, 118096269, 118095905, 118096227};
			anims[1828].anIntArray355 = new int[] {4, 4, 4, 4, 4, 4, 4, 4, 4, 4, 4, 4, 4, 4, 4, 4};
			break;
		case 1829:
			//fileID: 1802
			anims[1829] = new Animation();
			anims[1829].anInt352 = 16;
			anims[1829].anInt356 = -1;
			anims[1829].anInt359 = 5;
			anims[1829].anInt360 = -1;
			anims[1829].anInt361 = -1;
			anims[1829].anInt362 = 99;
			anims[1829].anInt363 = 0;
			anims[1829].anInt364 = 0;
			anims[1829].anInt365 = 2;
			anims[1829].aBoolean358 = false;
			anims[1829].anIntArray353 = new int[] {118096000, 118096073, 118095928, 118095889, 118095894, 118096223, 118096337, 118095979, 118096087, 118095980, 118096314, 118096202, 118095950, 118096110, 118096328, 118096221};
			anims[1829].anIntArray355 = new int[] {4, 4, 4, 4, 4, 4, 4, 4, 4, 4, 4, 4, 4, 4, 4, 4};
			break;

Anyway for me to files like these from osrs cache?
